page.title: 03The Parish Room
page.content: The first Parish Room was an army hut in the First World War. It was brought by train from London in l920. In l98l they thought it was getting old and scruffy so they decided to build a new one. In l984 it won a shield, cup and Â£200 because it was the best parish room in the south west of England. Now there are lots of things that go on in the Parish Room. Mainly it is used for Playschool which is held on Tuesday and Friday mornings and Youth Club which is held on Wednesday evenings. There are other things which go on in the Parish Room as well. The discos are once a month and old age pensioners go there once a month for coffee mornings. In the winter our school goes to the Parish Room to do P. E.
